text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly addresses the FTC limitation baskets by stating: \"the foreign tax credit benefit of any Luxembourg withholding tax on interest (typically reduced to zero under the U.S.-Luxembourg income tax treaty) may be limited in its utility depending on the parent's overall foreign tax credit position and the applicable Section 904 limitation basket.\" Furthermore, later in the response, it states: \"The foreign tax credits available under Section 960(d) are limited to 80 percent of the foreign taxes attributable to tested income, and they are subject to a separate GILTI basket limitation under Section 904(d).\" This directly satisfies the requirement that the response states taxpayers must compute a separate foreign tax credit (FTC) limitation for each designated category of income under \u00a7904.", "criterion_id": "3c466800-3224-4dbd-8c34-08b7ea0739ac"}
